alert.note: Alert for Brown (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 20 at 4:08PM MST until February 22 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 PM CST MONDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM MONDAY TO 6 PM CST TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 10 inches, with the highest amounts along the North Dakota/South Dakota border. Winds gusting as high as 30 mph. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 3 inches. Winds gusting as high as 30 mph. * WHERE...Brown County. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, from 9 PM this evening to 6 PM CST Monday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 6 PM Monday to 6 PM CST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The dangerously cold wind chills as low as 40 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
